lead_paragraph: The Justice Department confirmed that it had significant concerns that the merger “would make Comcast an unavoidable gatekeeper for Internet-based services that rely on a broadband connection to reach consumers.”

headline.print_headline: A Stranglehold on the Internet Is Averted
headline.main: Under Regulators’ Scrutiny, Comcast and Time Warner Cable End Deal

snippet: The Justice Department confirmed that it had significant concerns that the merger “would make Comcast an unavoidable gatekeeper for Internet-based services that rely on a broadband connection to reach consumers.”
abstract: Justice Dept and Federal Communications Commission confirm that they shared major concern about whether proposed Comcast takeover of Time Warner Cable would lead to new entity having too much power over Internet; concern points to marked shift in cable market toward dependency on Internet, which raised antitrust issues that relatively simpler merger of cable companies would not have.
